name: lib/DB.js
runQuery
description: Run a query against the DB

params.name: parameters
params.description: The parameters used in the query

name: lib/Graph.js
Graph
description: Object-Graph Map

name: db
description: Get a database instance.

name: build
description:
Build a graph from query results.
Map variables returned from the query to Nodes

params.name: parameters
params.description: The parameters used in the search query.

params.name: models
params.description: variables and Node models as key-value pairs.

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Graph.

params.name: models
params.description: variables and Node models as key-value pairs.

name: addRecords
description: Add records to the graph

name: addLinks
description: Link record items

name: add
description: Add one or more entities to the graph

name: remove
description: Remove one or more entities from the graph

name: typeOf
description: Get the type of the entity

unknown.tagValue: {string} Graph.TYPE_NODE, Graph.TYPE_RELATIONSHIP, Graph.TYPE_INTEGER or native JS type

return.description: Graph.TYPE_NODE, Graph.TYPE_RELATIONSHIP, Graph.TYPE_INTEGER or native JS type

name: getMap
description: Get the map used for the entity

name: getRelationship
description: Get Relationship from the graph

unknown.tagValue: {Relationship} Relationship or null if no match was found

return.description: Relationship or null if no match was found

name: getRelated
description: Get related nodes

name: lib/Node.js
QueryOptions
description: Query options object

properties.name: variable
properties.description: The variable used to identify the Node in the query, 'n' by default.

properties.name: variables
properties.description: All variables used in the query that should be added to the results.

properties.name: where
properties.description: The where clause, arrays are joined by the 'AND' operator.

properties.name: limit
properties.description: The maximum number of results to be returned

properties.name: with
properties.description: The name of relationship to include, use the dot-notation to include multiple levels

properties.name: with
properties.description: An array of names of relationships to include

properties.name: with
properties.description: Relationships to include (true) or exclude (false) or filter(object)

name: RelationshipDefinition
description: Relationship definition object

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Node.

params.name: node
params.description: Node data object or neo4j Node

name: uuid
description: ID generator, uses ShortId by default

name: id
description:
The node ID.
This will be automatically generated when the node is saved

name: $id
description:
The neo4j entity ID.
Note that this could change over time, use id instead.

name: $new
description: Whether or not the node is already stored in the graph database.

name: $dirty
description: Whether or not the Node has changed properties.

name: setProperty
description: Set property value

name: get
description: Get a Node property or related node(s).

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property or relationship

name: set
description: Set a Node property or related node(s).

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether or not the property was successfully set

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property or relationship

return.description: Whether or not the property was successfully set

name: relationships
description: Definitions of the relationships for this Node

name: getRelationship
description: Get a Relationship class by name.

name: getRelationship
description: Get a Relationship class by name.

name: getRelated
description: Get related node(s).

name: getLinked
description: Get linked results.

unknown.tagValue: {*} The related node(s) / value(s) or null if none is found

return.description: The related node(s) / value(s) or null if none is found

name: addRelated
description:
Add related node(s).
Existing nodes will not be overwritten unless the relationship is singular.

params.name: properties
params.description: Properties to set on the relationship(s)

name: setRelated
description: Set related node(s).

params.name: properties
params.description: Properties to set on the relationship(s)

params.name: overwrite
params.description: If set to false existing nodes will not be overwritten unless the relationship is singular

name: $labels
description:
Node labels. Will be added the node in the graph database.
By default it uses the constructor name.

name: $labels
description:
Node labels. Will be added the node in the graph database.
By default it uses the constructor name.

name: save
description: Save the Node to the graph database.

params.name: deep
params.description: If true save all related nodes

name: saveRelated
description: Save related nodes and their relationships

params.name: keys
params.description: The relationships to be saved (all by default)

name: delete
description: Delete node from the graph database

name: deleteRelated
description: Delete related nodes and their relationships

name: queryDefaults
description: Default values for query options

name: get
description: Fetch a single Node

name: all
description: Fetch Nodes

name: query
description:
Use a query statement to search for Nodes
By default returns results for 'n' as Node collection
examples:
const nodes = await Node.query(`
    MATCH (n:Node)
    WHERE n.foo > {foo}
`, { foo: 1 })

name: where
description:
Use a query statement to search for Nodes
By default returns results for 'n' as Node collection

name: find
description: Find Nodes based on filter or Node ID
examples:
// Find by ID
const nodes = Node.find('foo')

// Find by filter
const nodes = Node.find({ foo: 1 })

params.name: filters
params.description: Search filters, Node ID (string), or neo4j node identifier (number)

name: buildQuery
description: Build a search query

name: parseQueryFilters
description: Parse search filters

params.name: filters
params.description: Search filters, Node ID (string), or neo4j node identifier (number)

name: count
description: Count nodes in graph database

name: getRelationshipQueryOptions
description:
Build query options for related nodes
Mostly intended for internal usage.

params.name: levels
params.description: Filter for related nodes in dot-format (eg. father.children will fetch the related 'father' and its 'children')

params.name: variables
params.description: The variables currently used for building the query

params.name: reference
params.description: Reference variable for the current node

properties.name: variables
properties.description: The variables currently used for building the query

name: merge
description: Get a node or a create a new one based on the given properties

params.name: properties
params.description: Properties to be set on the existing or created node

name: fetchRelated
description: Fetch related Nodes connected to the current node.

name: lib/NodeCollection.js
lib/RelatedNode.js
lib/RelatedNodeCollection.js
lib/Relationship.js
Relationship
description: Class representing a relationship between two nodes

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance of Relationship

params.name: relation
params.description: Relationship data object or neo4j Relationship

name: $id
description:
The neo4j entity ID.
Note that this could change over time, use id instead.

name: $new
description: Whether or not the node is already stored in the graph database.

name: $dirty
description: Whether or not the Node has changed properties.

name: setProperty
description: Set property value

name: type
description: The type of the relationship, will be used as the name of the relationship created in the graph

name: singular
description: If true a relationship will always have only a single related Node

name: direction
description: The direction of the relationship, can be {@link Relationship.IN} or {@link Relationship.OUT}

name: Model
description: The related Node class or a function that returns a Node class

name: model
description: Alias for Model
